context:
Following are two different tax law cases for similar transaction type.

Case 1:
In the fiscal year under review, it has been noted that all meeting minutes have been duly stored in the database of Zeta Enterprises GmbH, a firm primarily engaged in the provision of IT consulting and software development services. Records reveal that these services, as per the established agreement, were provided in return for periodically assessed charges.

Throughout the fiscal year, the records exhibit a notable pattern of the parent company holding strategic decision-making responsibilities over the operations of Zeta Enterprises GmbH, as evidenced by extensive documentation of parent company board meetings. These documents show that within said period, decisions pertaining to five major market expansions for the Germany-based entity were executed at the parent company level.

A detailed review of the minutes from the board meetings at the parent level, during the same period, suggests a comprehensive decision-making process. Each set of minutes includes a list of attendees, presiding agenda items, key discussion points, as well as outcomes of deliberated decisions.

For the third and fourth quarter of fiscal year 20, examination of the Zeta Enterprises GmbH's regional headquarters' meeting minutes showed no recorded strategic decisions. This indicates limited decision-making autonomy within the regional entity during this period.

Looking at the firm's expansion activity within the fiscal year 2019-2020, it emerged that the local team of Zeta Enterprises GmbH initiated three new, but not novel, market expansions—all within existing markets previously active in the company's portfolio, as opposed to those dictated by the parent entity.

The audit of Zeta Enterprises GmbH's filings to Finanzamt München, within procedural timelines, acknowledge the inclusion of a strategic planning document. Within this document, sections detailing a market analysis, financial projections and risk considerations were evidently present.

Please note that all presented facts above are for the consideration of the court, and were derived from the review of documents and records corresponding to the fiscal year under scrutiny.

Case 2:
It was established that Konzern Deutschland AG submitted the report through the official digital medium of the Bundesamt für Justiz before the prescribed submission date. Examination of financial records indicated that management fees for the corporation were remitted on a quarterly basis, with no relation to the frequency or intensity of strategic decision-making events.

A detailed analysis prepared by the taxpayer was present in the records. The document provided a detailed overview of the shareholder engagements and the services extended during each quarter of the respective fiscal year. The absence of a direct correlation between the corporation's participation and the initiation of strategies in the minutes from the meetings held in Q1-Q4 2021 was noted upon review.

The full documentation, which outlined the nature and extent of services, was submitted on a digital platform under the Bundesamt für Justiz ahead of the stipulated cut-off date. Within the submitted materials, a thorough breakdown of services rendered and distribution among recipient entities for the fiscal year of 2021 was accounted for. The case remains under the preview of § 15 of the Income Tax Act, which governs the interpretation of cost allocation key for centralized services.

questions.question: Which case is more likely to be accepted?

root_structure.value: ['Finanzamt München'] should accept with conditions the arrangement by ['Zeta Enterprises GmbH'].

children.value: Applicable law is clear for ['Zeta Enterprises GmbH']'s arrangement.
Zeta Enterprises GmbH's arrangement involves the provision of services under specific agreements.
Zeta Enterprises GmbH's agreement is primarily related to the provision of IT consulting and software development services.
The services rendered by Zeta Enterprises GmbH, as per the agreement, are given in exchange for periodic charges.
When a company provides specific services under particular agreements, the nature of these services and the associated charges typically determine the applicable legal framework.
The nature of Zeta Enterprises GmbH's service arrangement aligns with domestic legal classification for service activities.
When arrangements pertain to the provision of services under specific conditions, related legal provisions provide unambiguous legal classification.
Economic activity is insufficient for ['Zeta Enterprises GmbH']'s operations.
Zeta Enterprises GmbH's regional headquarters only handle routine tasks with strategic decisions made by the parent company.
During Q3 and Q4 of FY20, no strategic decisions were recorded in Zeta Enterprises GmbH's regional headquarters' meeting minutes, implying a lack of autonomy.

The minutes from the parent company board meetings in the same period show that all strategic decisions relating to Zeta Enterprises GmbH – including those for IT consulting and software projects – were made at the parent company level.

When a subsidiary's role is reduced to executing routine tasks instructed by the parent company, and strategic decisions impacting the business are made exclusively by the parent company board, the subsidiary lacks meaningful operational autonomy.
Market expansion for Zeta Enterprises GmbH is primarily driven by parent company decisions rather than localized initiatives.
During FY2019-2020, Zeta Enterprises GmbH's local team initiated only 3 new market expansions, all in existing markets.
The parent company directed 5 major market expansions for Zeta Enterprises GmbH in the same period.
If the majority of market expansions for a subsidiary are initiated by the parent company, rather than the local team, meaningful economic substance at the local level may be lacking.
Economic substance often requires decision autonomy and the exercise of strategic initiatives at the operational level.
Procedural requirements are compliant for ['Zeta Enterprises GmbH']'s application.
Meeting minutes detail decision-making processes at Zeta Enterprises GmbH's regional headquarters and are available for review.
All meeting minutes, for each month during the fiscal year, were stored in Zeta Enterprises GmbH's database.
Each set of minutes includes the list of attendees, agenda, discussion points, and decisions made during the meeting.
When company meetings are systematically documented with participation and decision details, this fosters procedural transparency.
Planning documents delineate strategic initiatives undertaken by Zeta Enterprises GmbH and have been submitted.
The strategic planning document submitted by Zeta Enterprises GmbH contains sections on market analysis, financial projections, and risk considerations.
The document was part of the fiscal year filings submitted on time to Finanzamt München.
When planning documents contain key sections on strategy and are submitted within prescribed timelines, they contribute to the adherence of procedural standards.
Submission of detailed records showcasing decision-making and strategic planning processes can be indicative of procedural adherence.

root_structure.value: ['Bundesamt für Justiz'] should fully reject the arrangement by ['Konzern Deutschland AG'].

children.value: Applicable law is unclear for ['Konzern Deutschland AG']'s arrangement.
Konzern Deutschland AG's arrangement involves a service provision structure that incorporates a cost allocation key, the interpretation of which is variable under prevailing tax law.
While the arrangement somewhat corresponds to practices outlined in § 15, it lacks clarity in terms of accurate assignment under current legislation.
In intricate service arrangements, the precise interpretation of the tax law can, at times, be nebulous due to the variable interpretation of cost allocation key.
Economic activity is insufficient for ['Konzern Deutschland AG']'s operations.
Management fees are routinely incurred, however no definite evidence of decisions spearheaded by Konzern Deutschland AG exists.
Financial records show that management fees for Konzern Deutschland AG were paid out quarterly, regardless of the strategic decision-making output.
Review of meeting minutes from Q1-Q4 2021 did not indicate any direct contributions by or initiated strategies from Konzern Deutschland AG.
Continuous payment of management fees without clear evidence of strategic leadership raises questions about the genuine nature of the economic activity.
The entities incurring service fees fail to exhibit measurable gains attributable to the disbursed payments to Konzern Deutschland AG.
A purely financial relation between entities, without discernible mutual advantages, questions the legitimacy of the economic activity involved.
Procedural requirements are compliant for ['Konzern Deutschland AG']'s application.
Konzern Deutschland AG has submitted an analysis differentiating between shareholder activity and service classification, supported by contemporary evidence.
The analysis provided by Konzern Deutschland AG contained details about shareholder engagements and services offered, segregated for each quarter of the respective year.
The submission of the report was carried out through the official digital medium of Bundesamt für Justiz, prior to the defined submission date.
The successful filing of documents that categorize services and shareholder activities, when done within designated timelines, substantiates procedural adherence.
The provided documentation, covering the nature and extent of the services rendered, was submitted within the stipulated time period.
The documentation, detailing the nature of services and their extent, was delivered digitally via the online portal of Bundesamt für Justiz ahead of the cut-off date.
The submitted paperwork included a breakdown of services and their subsequent distribution amongst client entities for the fiscal year 2021.
When required documents detail services rendered and are submitted digitally ahead of deadline, it aligns with the procedural requirements of Bundesamt für Justiz.
Procedural compliance is satisfied when required documents are furnished accurately and within the designated timeframes.

applicable_law: § 15 Income Tax Act (profit allocation for service activities)
economic_activity: Regional headquarters charge but all decisions made at parent company board level
procedural_requirement: Management services documented with board meeting minutes and strategic planning deliverables
case_info.description:
Taxpayer: ['Zeta Enterprises GmbH']
Business sector: IT consulting and software development
Transaction type: service_arrangement
Applicable law: ['§ 15 Income Tax Act (profit allocation for service activities)']
Economic activity: ['Regional headquarters charge but all decisions made at parent company board level']
Procedural requirement: ['Management services documented with board meeting minutes and strategic planning deliverables']
Tax authority: ['Finanzamt München']

applicable_law: § 15 Income Tax Act (cost allocation key for centralized services interpretation varies)
economic_activity: Management fees but no documented strategic decisions or measurable benefits to recipients
procedural_requirement: Shareholder activity vs service classification analysis prepared with contemporaneous support
